## Why has rubisco not been replaced?
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">
* **Evolution of enzymes subject to strong biophysical constraints**
    * tradeoffs between activity and stability
 
 <br/>
 
* **Removing the oxygenation capability breaks rubisco**
    * heavy selection against modifying mutations

<br/>

* **RubisCO → RubisC**
    * requires a decrease in fitness 
    * "heartbeat of C3 photosynthesis"

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:300px; LEFT:550px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/rubisco_mutations.jpg">

## Evolution has tinkered with photosynthesis
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:300px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:300px; HEIGHT:200px" SRC="images/c3c4cam.jpg">

<div style="float: right; width: 55%;">

* **Improved and recombined existing parts and pieces**
 
<br/>

* **In response to environmental change**
    * lower [CO~2~]
    * high temperatures 
    * water limitations 

<br/>

* **Allowed plants to exploit new habitats**
</div>

## C4 photosynthesis: Evolved many times
<hr>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:175px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/c4map.png">

## Evolution of C4 photosynthesis
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right; width: 55%;">

* **C3 plants use the CO~2~ directly in the Calvin cycle**

<br/>

* **C4 plants first fix CO~2~ to PEP**

<br/>

* **Mesophyll cells @ top are CO~2~ pumps**
    * flood rubisco in **bundle sheath cells** with CO~2~

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:225px; LEFT:600px; WIDTH:350px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/c3vsc4.jpg">

## Functional change in bundle sheath cells (C3 -> C4)
<hr>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/c3_c4_anatomy.png"

<div class="item-absolute6"> Calvin cycle now occurs in BSC cells around leaf veins </div>

## Evolution of C4 photosynthesis: Why?
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right; width: 55%;">

* **C4 mechanism separates Calvin cycle from high O~2~**

<br/>

* **New enzyme, phosphoenolpyruvate carboxlylase (PEPC)**
    * fixes CO~2~ to PEP
    * no affinity for O~2~
    * 4C malate carries CO~2~ to Calvin cycle

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:225px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:350px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/c4.jpg">

## Why has C4 not taken over?
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right; width: 50%;">

* **Regeneration of PEP expensive (ATP)**
 
<br/>
 
* **Where is needed ATP generated?**

<br/>

* **Where should C4 plants live**
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:175px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:350px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/c4_2.jpg">

##
<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:150px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/c4_distribution.jpg">

**In hot conditions, the benefits of reduced photorespiration likely exceed the ATP cost of moving CO~2~ from the mesophyll cell to the bundle-sheath cell**
